Name: Removing fees associated with credit card bail payments and in relation to allowing online bail payment to be made by direct deposit and electronic check.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to removing fees associated with bail payments
Summary: This bill would remove the 2.49% fee charged on credit card payments of cash bail made using the online bail payment system, and would also remove the 8% fee charged on credit card payments of cash bail made in person.
Text:
Int. No. 1199-A

By Council Members Powers, Lancman, Brannan, Cohen, Dromm, Yeger, Treyger, Ampry-Samuel, Rosenthal, Gibson, Richards, Kallos, Levin, Rivera, Adams, Levine, Lander, Cumbo, Ayala, Reynoso, Chin, Constantinides, Holden and Miller

..TITLE
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to removing fees associated with bail payments
..Body 

Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Section 9-148 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new subdivision e to read as follows: 
      e. 1. No fee may be assessed on an online payment of bail, unless the chief administrator of the courts requires a party making a payment of bail to pay a reasonable administrative fee.
      2. No fee may be assessed on an in person payment of bail, unless the chief administrator of the courts requires a party making a payment of bail to pay a reasonable administrative fee. 
      ï¿½ 2. This local law takes effect 6 months after it becomes law, except that paragraph 2 of subdivision e of section 9-148 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by section one of this local law, takes effect 15 months after it becomes law.
